alert.note: Alert for Monroe (Mississippi) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Memphis (Western Tennessee, Eastern Arkansas and Northern Mississippi)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued March 04 at 10:44AM CST until March 05 at 1:30AM CST by NWS Memphis
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Mississippi... Tombigbee River near Amory affecting Monroe County. For the Tombigbee River...including Fulton, Bigbee, Amory, Aberdeen L & D...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL JUST AFTER MIDNIGHT TONIGHT... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Tombigbee River near Amory. * WHEN...Until just after midnight tonight. * IMPACTS...At 20.0 feet, Lowland flooding begins. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 10:15 AM CST Saturday the stage was 20.8 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 10:15 AM CST Saturday was 23.6 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage this evening and continue falling to 15.3 feet Tuesday morning. - Flood stage is 20.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 20.9 feet on 12/17/2000. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued late tonight at 1200 AM CST.
